docs.title: zzz-guides
docs.text:
• Official website
  • Documentation
  • Generator
  • Discord server

docs.title: About
docs.text:
SZGF stands for Standardized Zenless Zone Zero Guide Format, a YAML-based format for writing guides for agents in Zenless Zone Zero.

You can see it in action in the Hoyo Buddy Discord bot.

This repository contains:

  • /guides: SZGF guide files.
  • /schema.json: SZGF JSON schema file.
  • /szgf: Python SDK.
  • /assets: Drive disc, stats, and UI icons.
  • /docs: Documentation and contribution guidelines.

docs.title: Python SDK
docs.text:
You can use the SZGF Python SDK to download and read guides from this repository. The guides will be parsed using Pydantic and available as Python objects.

Install the package:

pip install szgf

Import and use the SZGFClient to fetch and read guides:

from szgf.client import SZGFClient
client = SZGFClient()
await client.download_guides()
guides = await client.read_guides() # Returns a dict of ParsedGuide objects

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: See CONTRIBUTING.md for contribution guidelines.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
You can check existing guides by using the /build zzz command in Hoyo Buddy.

Use the SZGF generator to write your guide using a user-friendly interface. The generator will help you create a valid guide file.

docs.title: Markdown
docs.text: The description and explanation fields accept Markdown formatting. See Discord's Markdown guide for details.

docs.title: UI Buttons
docs.text:
In the skill section, you might need to reference UI buttons. Use the following format:

Image UI Button Name Tag Basic Attack <basic> Dodge <dodge> Chain <chain> Special <special> Assist <assist> Core Skill <core>

Example:

skill:
  - name: "Assist Follow-Up: Hammer Bell"
    description: >-
      Press <basic> after a Defensive Assist to activate. Koleda charges and strikes enemies in front, dealing Fire DMG and obtaining Furnace Fire effect.
    explanation: >-
      Use this skill after a Defensive Assist to deal damage and gain Furnace Fire, which increases your damage output.

docs.title: Terminology
docs.text:
For consistency, the following terms are used throughout the repository:

  • Character: ZZZ agent.
  • Weapon: W-engine.
  • Rarity: ZZZ agent or weapon rank (S-rank: 5, A-rank: 4, B-rank: 3)

docs.title: Multi-line Text
docs.text:
For multi-line text in fields like description or explanation, use the >- YAML syntax to preserve new lines. Example:

description: >-
  This is a long sentence that
  spans multiple lines in the YAML file,
  but will be rendered as a single paragraph.

  An empty line indicates a new paragraph.

Renders as:

This is a long sentence that spans multiple lines in the YAML file, but will be rendered as a single paragraph.

An empty line indicates a new paragraph.

docs.title: SZGF Schema
docs.text:
Classes:

  • Section –

    A section, anything can be written, like additional explanations.

  • Character –

    A character in ZZZ.

  • WeaponSection –

    A weapon section for a character.

  • DiscSetSection –

    A drive disc set section.

  • DiscSection –

    A drive disc section for a character.

  • DiscMainStatSection –

    Main stat section for a drive disc.

  • StatSection –

    Stat section for a character.

  • MindscapeSection –

    A mindscape cinema section for a character.

  • SkillType –

    Types of skills in ZZZ.

  • SkillPrioritySection –

    Skill priority section for a character.

  • TeamMember –

    A team member in a team.

  • Team –

    A team that a character can be part of.

  • TeamSection –

    Team section for a character.

  • Skill –

    A skill of a character.

  • OriginalGuide –

    The standardized ZZZ guide format (SZGF) schema.

docs.title: Section pydantic-model
docs.text:
A section, anything can be written, like additional explanations.

Fields:

  • title (str)
  • description (str)

docs.title: title pydantic-field
docs.text:
title: str

Title of the section

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str

Description of the section

docs.title: Character pydantic-model
docs.text:
A character in ZZZ.

Fields:

  • name (str)
  • rarity (Literal[4, 5])
  • banner (str | None)

docs.title: name pydantic-field
docs.text:
name: str

Name of the character

docs.title: rarity pydantic-field
docs.text:
rarity: Literal[4, 5]

Rarity of the character, either 4 (A-rank) or 5 (S-rank) stars.

docs.title: banner pydantic-field
docs.text:
banner: str | None = None

A custom banner can be provided, otherwise defaults to M6 art.

docs.title: WeaponSection pydantic-model
docs.text:
A weapon section for a character.

Fields:

  • name (str)
  • description (str)
  • title (str | None)
  • icon (str | None)

docs.title: name pydantic-field
docs.text:
name: str

Name of the weapon

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str

Description of the weapon

docs.title: title pydantic-field
docs.text:
title: str | None = None

Title of the section. A custom title for the section can be provided, otherwise shows the ranking of the weapon, e.g. '2nd Best W-Engine.'

docs.title: icon pydantic-field
docs.text:
icon: str | None = None

Icon of the weapon. A custom icon can be provided, otherwise an icon will be fetched based on the name.

docs.title: DiscSetSection pydantic-model
docs.text:
A drive disc set section.

Fields:

  • name (str)
  • description (str)
  • icon (str | None)

docs.title: name pydantic-field
docs.text:
name: str

Name of the drive disc set

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str

Description for this section

docs.title: icon pydantic-field
docs.text:
icon: str | None = None

Icon of the drive disc set. A custom icon can be provided, otherwise an icon will be fetched based on the name.

docs.title: DiscSection pydantic-model
docs.text:
A drive disc section for a character.

Fields:

  • four_pieces (list[DiscSetSection])
  • two_pieces (list[DiscSetSection])
  • extra_sections (list[Section])

docs.title: four_pieces pydantic-field
docs.text:
four_pieces: list[DiscSetSection]

List of four-piece disc sets.

docs.title: two_pieces pydantic-field
docs.text:
two_pieces: list[DiscSetSection]

List of two-piece disc sets.

docs.title: extra_sections pydantic-field
docs.text:
extra_sections: list[Section]

Additional sections that can be added to the disc section.

docs.title: DiscMainStatSection pydantic-model
docs.text:
Main stat section for a drive disc.

Fields:

  • stat_priority (str)
  • pos (Literal[4, 5, 6])

docs.title: stat_priority pydantic-field
docs.text:
stat_priority: str

Priority of the main stat for this position's disc, e.g. 'ATK > CRIT DMG > CRIT RATE'.

docs.title: pos pydantic-field
docs.text:
pos: Literal[4, 5, 6]

Position of the disc, either 4, 5, or 6.

docs.title: StatSection pydantic-model
docs.text:
Stat section for a character.

Fields:

  • main_stats (list[DiscMainStatSection])
  • sub_stats (str)
  • baseline_stats (str)
  • extra_sections (list[Section])

docs.title: main_stats pydantic-field
docs.text:
main_stats: list[DiscMainStatSection]

List of main stats for each disc position (4, 5, 6).

docs.title: sub_stats pydantic-field
docs.text:
sub_stats: str

Priority of sub stats for the character, e.g. 'ATK > CRIT DMG > CRIT RATE > SPD'.

docs.title: baseline_stats pydantic-field
docs.text:
baseline_stats: str

Baseline stats for the character, e.g. 'ATK: 1000, DEF: 500, HP: 2000'.

docs.title: extra_sections pydantic-field
docs.text:
extra_sections: list[Section]

Additional sections that can be added to the stat section.

docs.title: MindscapeSection pydantic-model
docs.text:
A mindscape cinema section for a character.

Fields:

  • num (Literal[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6])
  • description (str)

docs.title: num pydantic-field
docs.text:
num: Literal[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]

Number of the mindscape, from 1 to 6.

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str

Description of the mindscape, explaining its effects and importance.

docs.title: SkillType
docs.text:
Types of skills in ZZZ.

Attributes:

  • CORE –
  • BASIC –
  • DODGE –
  • SPECIAL –
  • CHAIN –
  • ASSIST –

docs.title: CORE class-attribute instance-attribute
docs.text: CORE = 'core'

docs.title: BASIC class-attribute instance-attribute
docs.text: BASIC = 'basic'

docs.title: DODGE class-attribute instance-attribute
docs.text: DODGE = 'dodge'

docs.title: SPECIAL class-attribute instance-attribute
docs.text: SPECIAL = 'special'

docs.title: CHAIN class-attribute instance-attribute
docs.text: CHAIN = 'chain'

docs.title: ASSIST class-attribute instance-attribute
docs.text: ASSIST = 'assist'

docs.title: SkillPrioritySection pydantic-model
docs.text:
Skill priority section for a character.

Fields:

  • priorities (list[list[SkillType]])
  • description (str | None)

docs.title: priorities pydantic-field
docs.text:
priorities: list[list[SkillType]]

List of skill priorities, where each sublist represents a priority level. For example, [[core, basic], [special, dodge]] means the first priority is core and basic skills, and the second priority is special and dodge skills.

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str | None = None

Description of the skill priority section

docs.title: TeamMember pydantic-model
docs.text:
A team member in a team.

Fields:

  • name (str)

docs.title: name pydantic-field
docs.text:
name: str

Name of the team member

docs.title: Team pydantic-model
docs.text:
A team that a character can be part of.

Fields:

  • name (str)
  • characters (list[TeamMember])
  • description (str | None)

docs.title: name pydantic-field
docs.text:
name: str

Name of the team

docs.title: characters pydantic-field
docs.text:
characters: list[TeamMember]

List of characters in the team

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str | None = None

Description of the team

docs.title: TeamSection pydantic-model
docs.text:
Team section for a character.

Fields:

  • teams (list[Team])
  • extra_sections (list[Section])

docs.title: teams pydantic-field
docs.text:
teams: list[Team]

List of teams that the character can be part of.

docs.title: extra_sections pydantic-field
docs.text:
extra_sections: list[Section]

Additional sections for the team section.

docs.title: Skill pydantic-model
docs.text:
A skill of a character.

Fields:

  • title (str)
  • description (str)
  • explanation (str)
  • demo (str | None)

docs.title: title pydantic-field
docs.text:
title: str

Title of the skill

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str

Description of the skill

docs.title: explanation pydantic-field
docs.text:
explanation: str

Explanation of the skill mechanics

docs.title: demo pydantic-field
docs.text:
demo: str | None = None

Demo GIF of the skill

docs.title: OriginalGuide pydantic-model
docs.text:
The standardized ZZZ guide format (SZGF) schema.

Fields:

  • author (str)
  • last_updated (date)
  • character (Character)
  • description (str)
  • weapons (list[WeaponSection])
  • discs (DiscSection | None)
  • stat (StatSection | None)
  • skill_priority (SkillPrioritySection | None)
  • skills (list[Skill])
  • mindscapes (list[MindscapeSection])
  • team (TeamSection | None)
  • rotation (Section | None)

docs.title: author pydantic-field
docs.text:
author: str

Author of the guide

docs.title: last_updated pydantic-field
docs.text:
last_updated: date

Last updated date of the guide

docs.title: character pydantic-field
docs.text:
character: Character

Character information

docs.title: description pydantic-field
docs.text:
description: str

Description of the guide, explaining its purpose and content.

docs.title: weapons pydantic-field
docs.text:
weapons: list[WeaponSection]

List of weapon sections for the character.

docs.title: discs pydantic-field
docs.text:
discs: DiscSection | None = None

Disc section for the character.

docs.title: stat pydantic-field
docs.text:
stat: StatSection | None = None

Stat section for the character.

docs.title: skill_priority pydantic-field
docs.text:
skill_priority: SkillPrioritySection | None = None

Skill priority section for the character.

docs.title: skills pydantic-field
docs.text:
skills: list[Skill]

List of skills for the character.

docs.title: mindscapes pydantic-field
docs.text:
mindscapes: list[MindscapeSection]

List of mindscapes for the character.

docs.title: team pydantic-field
docs.text:
team: TeamSection | None = None

Team section for the character.

docs.title: rotation pydantic-field
docs.text:
rotation: Section | None = None

Rotation section for the character, explaining how to use skills effectively.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install szgf

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
from szgf.client import SZGFClient

client = SZGFClient()
await client.download_guides()
guides = await client.read_guides()
print(guides['1011']) # Anby

docs.title: Python SDK API Reference
docs.text:
Classes:

  • SZGFClient –

    Client for interacting with the SZGF guides repository.

docs.title: SZGFClient
docs.text:
Client for interacting with the SZGF guides repository.

Methods:

  • download_guides –

    Download all guides from the GitHub repository and store them locally.

  • read_guides –

    Read all locally stored guides and parse them into ParsedGuide objects.

  • start –

    Start the client session.

  • close –

    Close the client session.

Attributes:

  • session (ClientSession) –

docs.title: session property
docs.text: session: ClientSession

docs.title: download_guides async
docs.text:
download_guides() -> None

Download all guides from the GitHub repository and store them locally.

docs.title: read_guides async
docs.text:
read_guides() -> dict[str, ParsedGuide]

Read all locally stored guides and parse them into ParsedGuide objects.

Returns:

  • dict[str, ParsedGuide] –

    A dictionary mapping character IDs to ParsedGuide objects.

docs.title: start async
docs.text:
start() -> None

Start the client session.

docs.title: close async
docs.text:
close() -> None

Close the client session.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: npm install szgf

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
import { SZGFClient } from 'szgf';

const client = new SZGFClient();
await client.downloadGuides();
const guides = await client.readGuides();
console.log(guides['1011']); // Anby
const anbyGuide = await client.getGuide('Anby');
await client.clearGuides();
